messages.message:
:wave: This was postponed a bit to handle some other more emergent things, and I'm revisiting it now. :slightly_smiling_face:

To reduce the cost of the test run, I'm actually (edited) going to *only copy those images that have been pulled in the last 90 days* in `instabase-dev`, `instabase-build`, and `instabase-dogfood`.

(When we get  `instabase-public` scheduled I'll copy all images, but that's for later).

_Edit: Turns out the automatic migration tooling from Google allows me to decide what is to be copied, so no need to do the giant purge - they'll just all go away when we decommission GCR after the migration + cutover._

~going to purge *anything older than 90 days*  in the `gcr.io/instabase-dev (http://gcr.io/instabase-dev)` registry.~

~A dry-run of `gcr-cleaner` with a grace period of 90d yields just shy of `18,000` image digests to be deleted across `248` repos, and given the bloat of our images - it'll be a _ton_ of data to shovel over.~ :sweat_smile:

~I'll make more judicious use of this cleanup mechanism for `instabase-public`, but I believe anything older than 90 days in `instabase-dev`, `instabase-build` , and `instabase-dogfood` should be fair game for deletion.~ :slightly_smiling_face:
